outputs.description: Strengthened capacity of EPI programme  to manage, maintain and monitor cold chain systems and vaccines supplies annually
By 2012, Adolescents living with HIV (ALHIV) access psycho-social support services in all 10 districts.
Targeted communities in all districts have knowledge and skills to exercise healthy sanitation and hygiene practices  by 2018.
By end ot 2017, the knowledge foundation (gap analysis, costs, etc.) is in place for the effective implementation of theChildren's Protection and Welfare Act 2011 (CPWA)

By end ot 2018, the organisational and institutional capacity of the Ministry of Social Development (MOSD) is strengthened todeliver effective welfare and protection services to vulnerable children and their families
Coordination of the National response to Orphans and other Vulnerable is improved
Awareness on the CPW Act provisions among key stakeholders increased
Increased national capacity to provide access to integrated services essential for scaling up, monitoring and generation ofknowledge for PMTCT and ART for adolescents and children by end of 2018
Strengthen community based structures to generate demand for MNCH services that will enhance increased uptake and retention intoMNCH services

By 2012, 80% of young women and young men, aged 10 to 24 year olds, who participated in the HIV risk reduction and avoidanceinterventions both in and out of school, have comprehensive knowledge on HIV and AIDS.
By end of 2018, evidence is generated and used to influence social budgeting and advocate for child-friendly sector budgets,social and economic policies and legislative measures
By end ot 2018, National M & E System is supported for the collection, analysis and dissemination of strategic information forplanning and implementation of national policies
Improved national capacity to coordinate, track and provide HIV services for adolescents in all districts, particularlyadolescent girls by 2018.
Enhanced ability of at least 40,000 adolescents to practice healthy behaviors related to HIV and AIDS by end 2018
Institutional capacity of DSW strengthened
The Lesotho Child Grants Programme scaled up
Institutional arrangements for social safety nets established and capacitated.
Capacity of state and non state NFE providers  in mountain districts strengthened to provide quality education to herd boys andother working children
Output 2: Capicity of MOET is enhanced to coordinate, plan, implement, and monitor provision of quality basic education withspecial attention for children with disabilities
By December 2012, communities in districts with PMTCT uptake below the national average are mobilised to utilise PMTCT andtreatment serivces for HIV and AIDS in children
By December 2012, all the 200 ANC and ART facilities have the capacity to deliver quality PMTCT and Paediatric HIV Care services
Output 6.1  Improved quality and access to ECD services  especially for vulnerable children
Output 5.2. One social protection system (at the central level) is developed and implemented by integrating and harmonizingdifferent social protection schemes.

IR 1.4: Health systems stengthened stengthened for evidence-based planning, budgeting and costing that ensures capacity forimplementation of high impact maternal, neonatal and infant health and HIV interventions and a 5% piont increase in access to theseinterventions as well as an improvement in quality, including during emergencies by December 2012.
By end of December 2012, support districts with low performance in immunization to provide an integrated package of Maternal,Neonatal and Child Survival (MNCS) interventions
By end of 2012, an effective preventive and curative package of nutrition interventions implemented in 7 districts.
Output 5.3.  A model of integrated of social assistance as well as conditional cash transfer piloted to improve effectiveness,efficiency of social protection programme
IR5:  Strengthened capacity at national and sub-national level to monitor and evaluate the implementation process and respond toemergencies.
By 2012, Child Helpline services available in all districts through three regional offices.
By 2012, enabling environment for provision of IECCD services  is created  for children

Duty bearers and claim holders are sensitized about  Education Act 2010 to operationalize free and compulsory primary education andcreate a child friendly environment in primary schools by the end of 2012
Increased access to quality non-formal education for over aged excluded girls and boys in 10 districts with a specialattention to herdboys by 2017
PRIOR-YEAR COMMITMENTS
IR 3:  Suppy and Procurement
National Strategic Development Plan influenced towards addressing child and women welfare and protection issues.
IR 1: Knowledge management systems both in UNICEF and among key partners strengthened
IR 4: Meetings/Workshops and other Admin
At least 50% of primary schools created child friendly environment as per CFS minimum standards
Supply and Logistics for office
Communication for Development (C4D) & External Relations
Technical Support and Monitoring and Evaluation for Effective Programme Delivery
Output 5.1. By end of 2014, the Child Grants Programme (CGP) is expanded to selected communities in all 10 districts, targeting themost vulnerable children and their families.
Meetings/Workshops/Misc.
ICT Equipment and Administrative Functions.
LESOTHO COUNTRY PROGRAMME (2002 - 2007)
IR 9.1: Effective and Efficient Governance and Systems

By 2012, 80% adolescent focused GO and NGO partners are able to implement HIV interventions specifically to decrease age differenceof sexual partners among young people and increase condom and HTC utilisation.
